Package edu.ntnu.idatt1002.k2_2.mitodo.data.project

Class Project

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt1002.k2_2.mitodo.data.project.Project
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RootProject, UserProject
public abstract class Project
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Abstract class representing a Project with an ID, a list of tasks and a list of projects.
See Also:

    • getProjects

      public java.util.ArrayList<UserProject> getProjects()
      Returns:
      This project's projects.

    • getAllProjects

      public java.util.ArrayList<UserProject> getAllProjects()
      Returns:
      All projects below this project. That is to say, the subprojects of this project and all subprojects of the subprojects.

    • addProject

      Parameters:
      title - The title of the new project.
      Returns:
      The newly created project.

    • addProject

      protected void addProject​(UserProject userProject)
      Protected method allowing the child class to add a project to this project.
      Parameters:
      userProject - The project to add.

    • moveProject

      public boolean moveProject​(UserProject subproject, int newIndex)
      Moves a project in this project to a different index in the list.
      Parameters:
      subproject - The project to move.
      newIndex - The index to move to the project to.
      Returns:
      False if the project is not in this project or the new index is equal to the old index. Otherwise true.

    • removeProject

      public boolean removeProject​(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes a project from this project.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the project to remove.
      Returns:
      True if the project was removed. Otherwise false.

    • removeProjectFromAll

      public boolean removeProjectFromAll​(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes a project from this project and all projects below this project.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the project to remove.
      Returns:
      True if the project was removed. Otherwise false.

    • getAllTasks

      public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getAllTasks()
      Returns:
      The tasks of this project and the tasks of all projects below this project.

    • getTasks

      public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks()
      Returns:
      A shallow copy of the ArrayList of tasks in this project.

    • addTask

      public Task addTask​(java.lang.String title, PriorityEnum priority, java.time.LocalDate startDate, java.time.LocalDate dueDate, RepeatEnum repeat, java.lang.String comments)
      Adds a new task to this project.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the new task.
      priority - The priority of the new task.
      startDate - The start date of the new task.
      dueDate - The due date of the new task.
      repeat - The repeating frequency of the new task.
      comments - The comments of the new task.
      Returns:
      The newly created task.

    • moveTask

      public boolean moveTask​(Task task, int newIndex)
      Moves a task in this project to a different index in the list.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to move.
      newIndex - The index to move to the task to.
      Returns:
      False if the task is not in this project or the new index is equal to the old index. Otherwise true.

    • moveTaskTo

      public boolean moveTaskTo​(Task task, Project newParentProject)
      Moves a task to a different project.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to move.
      newParentProject - The project to move the task to.
      Returns:
      True if the task was moved to the new project and removed from the old project. Otherwise false.
